channel.title: INfinance
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INfinance, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: These ideal investments for retirees have almost never been this attractive heading into 2025
Our Retirement Goal for 2025: Make Home a Place of Comfort---and Change
item.description: It isn’t always easy for us to be content staying put. The answer may be to look for adventure in our own backyard.

item.title: The WSJ Dollar Index Rises 7.22% This Year to 102.76
item.description: The dollar edged higher on the session to end the year up 7.2%, matching its annual gains in 2022.

item.title: U.S. Stocks Slip on Last Day of Stellar Year
item.description: Major U.S. stock indexes ended Tuesday’s session in the red, but wrapped up a stellar 2024.

item.title: I’m the executor of my 90-year-old aunt’s estate. A neighbor threatened me and wants to buy her house. What should I do?
item.description: “I believe she doesn’t have that much time left.”

item.title: These are the most popular Moneyist columns of 2024
item.description: Divorce, student debt, airline travel, house purchase and inheritance comprised the top 5 most read columns of the year.

item.title: How Five Pros Are Inflation-Proofing Their Investments
item.description: Some on Wall Street think the fight to stabilize prices isn’t over yet.

item.title: ‘He ended up homeless and penniless’: My uncle conned my father into signing over their mother’s house. What can I do?
item.description: “His brother went to the prison where my dad was incarcerated and had him sign over the house.”

item.title: SEC Writes Off $10 Billion in Fines It Can't Collect
item.description: Internal data shows securities enforcers bring in far less money than their cases indicate.

item.title: ‘Should I feel guilty?’ My elderly neighbor and friend of 5 years left me her $1 million home. Do I split it with her two sons?
